website_summaries.verdict: The Optoma HD26 home theater projector suffers from some image-quality issues in its brightest predefined mode, but delivers excellent quality with other modes.
pros: Two HDMI connectors, one with Mobile High-Definition Link (MHL)
cons: Shows rainbow artifacts, particularly in black-and-white film clips
Has additional image-quality issues in its brightest predefined mode

customer_reviews.title: This is the one.
customer_reviews.text: i read more reviews than I care to admit and almost read TOO MANY because I nearly got to the point where I thought no projector was any good. Don't worry about DLP rainbows with this. They don't exist. The contrast is good and the black is black. It's very quiet and the color presets are handy. Set up was also pretty simple for a fairly tech illiterate person like myself. The speaker is useable but I recommend hooking it up with external speakers or sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: The projector worked wonderfully for a year
customer_reviews.text: The projector worked wonderfully for a year, and then almost to the day, a year later, it made a very loud popping sound, and then stopped projecting. I give it two stars, because while it worked, it looked amazing. Edit: I am upgrading my review to 4 stars, because i ordered a replacement bulb, and it was easy to install. I do recommend this projector, as it has served me well, and looks fantastic for the price. Well done. Edit number 2: The second bulb lasted about 2 months. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Thor Allen

customer_reviews.title: 5 years and 2730 lamp hours later
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Optoma HD26 ~5 years ago (November 2015). After 2730 lamp hours I have had zero complications. What amazes me is that projectors in 2020 have the same specs (25,000:1 contrast, 3200 lumens, 1080p) for the same price as this 2015 HD26. My 5 year old Samsung LED TV was at the edge of what was possible at the time. Now I'm lucky if I sell it for $100. I was researching buying a new projector because I assumed they progressed like LED TVs. It appears I'll be keeping this projector for many more years,
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rose

customer_reviews.title: Mileage may vary
customer_reviews.text: I got my Optoma HD26 in July 2016 and it worked great at first. It's not overly used as the internal lamp time says it's only been on for about 150 hours. Just recently, it started having a sound issue. The sound just dies at random. Sometimes, a hard reset of the unit will get the sound back. Sometimes I have to do this 5 times to get it back. When it does cut out, it's for both the internal speaker and the audio out jack. When you are spending this kind of money, you expect more. I'm very disappointed. I was going to give it 1 star but the video quality was good so i'll leave it at 2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good projector, terrible support
customer_reviews.text: The projector itself is good quality, good image, but the technical support sucks. After having this projector for several years, somehow a dust particle got into the sealed light path. I contacted support for help but thier only answer was to return the projector for paid service. I'm pretty confident I could handle it on my own if I had a decent manual, but I was told they don't provide technical manuals to the public. Just a way to force consumers to buy their overpriced service. If you are a do it yourself type, consider yourself warned you will get no help from optoma.
customer_reviews.author: B. Milliron

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for a home theater room
customer_reviews.text: I love this projector. Great color out of the box, I bought the WOW disc to calibrate it, but it needed very little adjustment. I use this projector with a grey screen and the black levels are stellar! You can spend a lot more on a projector, and while this one is limited on it's placement, with only modest screen shift and zoom ability, the picture it produces is fantastic and I can't imagine a much better picture at twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Good products, minor cons
customer_reviews.text: The Good: The picture has been very good. The remote is small and backlit. The 3D feature works well XBMC/Kodi and The Bad: The built-in sound dies after a couple of months. We had to connect it to external speakers to get sound again. The remote functions are not intuitive. The lamp blasted off within 200 hours of use. To be fair, it may have been due to temperature built-up as a lot of dust may have clogged the vents. (We live in a dusty environment). Though I was able to get them replaced easily after cleaning up and getting the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Manish

customer_reviews.title: Great images for a budget projector but loud fan
customer_reviews.text: This thing for the money is the bees knees. The color quality is great, the 3d works very well, and it projects a huge screen. We use it in our loft as a 132" screen on a blank wall. The wall was painted with a soft gray paint and a 6" black boder to simulate a screen and it works perfectly. The only drawback is the obnoxiously loud fan on the projector. If you're watching a movie with a quiet scene it could get a little bothersome but usually I'm so fixed on what I'm watching it doesn't bother. 4 stars because of the excessive fan noise.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Iwanicha

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS CRAP! (OR give into the con and purchase the extra warranty!)
customer_reviews.text: WASTE OF MONEY!!! 2 months shy of having it 2 years the light bulb blew up - LITERALLY BLEW UP - inside the machine. Replaced the bulb - worked well for three weeks then that light blew. Replaced the bulb AGAIN and the machine won't even turn on now. Of course, the warranty is only good for 1 year. I guess they make it blow up after that year is up. Though it LOVED it for the year and a half it worked, in retrospect, now that I have to purchase a brand new projector...I should have just put the money into an awesome 4K TV that would, by all accounts, still be working fine today.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Do it
customer_reviews.text: Great price, looks great, make sure to get the right mount and get someone to hang it for you and hide all the wires, amazon did it cheep for me, def worth it. Used paint to get the screen and hooked it to surround sound speakers, all and all probably coast $1200, worth every penny OmniMount 3N1-PJT B Projector Mount Paint On Screen Projector Screen Paint - Digital Theater White-Quart Q002 VIZIO SB4051-C0 40-Inch 5.1 Sound Bar System with Wireless Subwoofer & Rear Satellite Speakers
customer_reviews.author: Austin Kuras

customer_reviews.title: Super happy!!
customer_reviews.text: We mounted this upside down about 14 feet from the wall and the picture is HUGE! It's about 10 feet wide! We installed it in the kids playroom and they love playing multi-player games because each screen is about the size of our flat screen upstairs (with four players). You can't beat the price for a screen this big! Great quality picture, too. Very, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tawny

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Super happy with the price & quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've had an Optoma EP719 for years, still going on the original bulb. Since we are finishing our "theater room" in the basement, we wanted to get an HD upgrade. The obvious choice for us, due to having had another serve us so long and so well, was another Optoma. My kids lit up when they saw how much clearer and brighter this projector was, to say nothing of all of their video games running in 1080p now. Very happy with this purchase. It's 2db quieter than my old EP719, so this makes it even nicer!.
customer_reviews.author: untergeek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome picture, attache it to a sorround system and you have a theater experience
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture...I am so happy I chose this brand, after much research online. I chose the Optoma and I am using a Homegear 120" motorized projector with it in my living room. I didnt want a huge TV screen in my living room upstairs. I just wanted to walk in the room and see my beautiful fireplace. I got this accomplished with the projector. I hanged the projector to the ceiling and I am pretty proud of how uncluttered the room looks but when we want to watch movies we have a theater experience. I am going to be buying another one for my basement and do the same set up. Thank you for making such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Esther Blasco

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to align
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a week. Will update. Pros Works very well. Have an Xbox one hooked up to it. It's easy to align. Many options to assist. 3d works great. I play crisis 3 in it. Amazing. I am using active 3d glasses. Cons Depending on what colour setting you have there can be moments of white wash. Fan is loud. When silent moments between episodes the fan is noticeable surround sound when used it makes it unnoticeable. Overall I love it it takes some time to customize to your best setting takes time. But worth the effort. Cheap enough to put in more than one room. Invest in a good screen... It will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jas

customer_reviews.title: Newer, But Better?
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Optoma projector for my home theater as an upgrade to the HD70 model purchased on Amazon 2011 (rated 5 stars). The TI dark chip is the same but the color wheel is not. Promotion is more lumens and 1080p vs 720p. Yes the resolution is marginally higher but in "cinema mode" the brightness is the same and still requires a dark room to enjoy. The price point was right but I expected more performance for my dollars in 2014. Only 90 day warranty ?, early reports of failures? RMAs? I bought an extended warranty this time even tho HD 70 has been flawless. We'll see. (4 stars for now)
customer_reviews.author: scottmc

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector
customer_reviews.text: Purchased iHD26 n December 2014 and it's still going strong. Gets used daily with a PS4 and have watched numerous movies and YouTube videos. Positioned it at 13 feet away from the 144 inch screen and the images look great in 1080P. Play it though a 7:2 surround sound system and Yamaha amp and concerts come alive. Hard to beat a 144 inch TV at this price!
customer_reviews.author: HowzitUSA

customer_reviews.title: Best Picture & Sound quality, with 1 flaw
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded from LG 4:3 projector to Optoma HD26, and it's worth the upgrade. It produces loud sound, to go with it's amazing picture quality. My only concern was it's controls are on the left side, which makes it harder to connect when it's in a box.Also, I tried Roku streaming stick with it, but the MHL port did not seem to power the device, and I had to connect the charger separately on wall. But as far as Picture & Sound quality is concerned, it's one of the best in it's range. I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't care about USB powered sticks.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Optoma HD26
customer_reviews.text: This projector has excellent color but during action scenes the movement blurs which for me makes the experience unexcepable. The 3d experience on the Lion king 3d was exceptional but the three other movies we watched in 3d made all 13 of us dizzy and it seemed like the main character was in 3d but everything else was blury. Not a good experience at all. (Journey to the center of earth 3d, jarassic world 3d, & REO3d) Glasses we bought are the Emgreat 4x G15-DLP 144Hz 3D they were rated 4.5 stars for DLP projectors.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome projector.
customer_reviews.text: This projector was recommended by Carl's Place to use with my 9' X 16' backyard movie screen. Once the sun goes down and the lights go out this thing is the bomb! The 1080i HD picture is phenominal, it just blows me away, it really is like being in a movie theater. I know you can spend a ton more money on better projectors but I can't imagine it being worth the cost, use the money you saved and buy a popcorn machine.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Linzel

customer_reviews.title: ... this projector for about two years and was fairly pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this projector for about two years and was fairly pleased with it; however, now I'm also seeing the issue where it just locks up. The projector will not respond to any button and can only be turned off by unplugging. This issue will most certainly cause the bulb to burn out earlier than it should since the fan turns off when it's unplugged. I've never had a projector mess up in less than three years. It's clear that quality was not a concern when this projector was developed.
customer_reviews.author: rzxn30

customer_reviews.title: Tried the HD26 and HT2050, Chose the BenQ HT2050
customer_reviews.text: If you are on a budget and don't mind slightly washed out colors get this projector. I've had hands on experience with this projector, the UC40 and the BenQ HT2050. Out of all three I chose the BenQ for much richer colors and overall higher quality. This really is a great projector aside from suffering from dull colors. Very crisp and clear picture. Blacks also pretty washed out. Very low imput lag, which outperforms the BenQ projector in response time. Optima does have great customer service as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just fantastic..
customer_reviews.text: Just fantastic...the best projector I have had for home entertainment. It is somewhat of a "short throw," at 23 feet from the wall, the minimum picture width is just shy of fifteen feet, the width of the wall. The picture is relatively bright, even in eco mode...we can't control all the daylight that gets in, but, after a few minutes of eyes adjusting, football and golf look great. The Fire TV output, at true 1080p, is just stunning!...so much better than satellite.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: This is my first projector and I am very happy that I bought this one
customer_reviews.text: This is my first projector and I am very happy that I bought this one. Excellent video quality. I used one of my walls as my projector screen painted it with "Behr Matte White". and the result was awesome! The picture was so clear! I connected my laptop through HDMI to watch anything from the internet. I have a Bose speakers connected on my laptop. This is my sound system for now. The sound is great! I am still trying to find a good receiver to hookup my DVD/BD players. But overall.....GREAT CHOICE FOR A BIG SCREEN!!
customer_reviews.author: Renato Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this back in 2015 and i still use it til this day. Great projector. Super bright. No bulb replacement yet. I’ve been using it everyday since then. Screen quality is clear. With maybe 20% light exposure, max.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Had for 2 years and still love it.
customer_reviews.text: We love our projector and used it as an everyday TV for over a year (6-10hr days) until needing to replace the bulb. It's obviously better in the dark, but very tolerable during the day too. I just bought darker curtains. Also, it is not loud at all and it was sitting on a shelf directly behind our heads. Great for movies, games, everything.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryne

customer_reviews.title: Best decision I've had in a while!
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a projector as my main TV and we decided to save a few hundred dollars over a new flat screen TV and double the size. I don't even have a screen, I shoot it right on the opposing wall and it looks amazing. We've got a 120" picture that's crystal clear. I wish I had done this earlier. It's not perfect on bright sunny days but it's acceptable and more than makes up for it at night. I have not tried the 3D yet but plan to try it with Gran Turismo 6 once I get a pair of glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Monty Dubya

customer_reviews.title: ... in a blue ray dvd and it will look awesome. I was worried about the overall quality of ...
customer_reviews.text: pop in a blue ray dvd and it will look awesome. I was worried about the overall quality of the projector, but I am absolutely spellbound by it. Everyone's jaws drop when they comes over for movie nights (you can see EVERY fine line, color, spec and detail with a blue ray). PLUS I do not use it for a 3d player. Don't let the title discourage you. It's versatile. It is probably placed 20 feet away from my wall? But i think it covers 10by15 (size depends on how far you place the projector). pretty awesome! Don't think twice! Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Gresham

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome. We borrowed a couple of low end models to try out, you get what you pay for... if you want to watch outside you will want at least a 12x7 or bigger screen. We bought a 10x5 and can't get the projector close enough without blocking the screen. No complaints after 3 weeks. I use vlc on a windows 8.1 laptop for video, works much better than native windows. You will want a small PA system for outside as the builtin speaker just won't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: HDCP error turned projector into worthless brick
customer_reviews.text: After a very few hours of time on this projector it started getting an HDCP (HD Content Protection) error. I needed to make a presentation so had to buy a different one. Dig it out of the box a year or so later to see if I could get it working. I called support and the tech kept repeating “our devices are HDCP complient” no matter how I tried to explain the problem. Thanks a bunch for the $650 brick. I’m sure a firmware update would fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Conrad

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT! NO REGRETS!
customer_reviews.text: I Did a TON of research before buying this and i am very happy with the choice i made. Runs quite and smooth. Easy set up. Plug and play. Bright enough. Picture clarity was suprisingly great. Friends and family all want to buy one after seeing mine. For a mid price range projector this a win in my book. Buy it, you wont regret it. Xbox looks AMAZING playing the division is like real life. its unbelievable!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Talley

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, a bit noisy
customer_reviews.text: The picture is great, and I had it at 180" diagonal. However, it is a bit louder than I would like. But I will say that you normally can only notIce it when watching a movie or show and it is a quiet scene. But then the projector noise is practically the only thing I notice. I put about 750 bulb hours into this projector and my only complaint had ever been the noise, which is still less compared to some others. But I recently moved to an Optoma HD142X and it is whisper quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I have always owned Optoma so wanted to stay in that brand. I was almost persuaded to go with the Benq w1070 but glad I stayed with my first choice. After 14 years of the Optoma 735 (which still works great by the way) I was ready to go to true HDMI and a little brighter picture. All of my friends who had watched Super Bowls and movies on the old projector are absolutely blown away with the new one. Crystal clear 1080 picture, great brightness, probably too much for my windowless theater. With the quieter noise and longer lamp life I feel that I am in for another 14+ years with this projector.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Catmull

customer_reviews.title: Love this projector!
customer_reviews.text: It has been perfect for my room. I have it at 14'6" from the wall projecting on aand it works wonderfully both with the lights on or off. During the day I usually change the mode to bright/vivid to make up for all the windows we have in the room (2 double french doors, single door, 2 windows) but if the lights are only on vivid/cinema is find and with the lights off I prefer the cinema in order to get the deeper blacks.
customer_reviews.author: Knoxie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome clear picture that is second to none.
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality on this is top notch. Initially, we projected this on a beige wall. When my mother came over, the picture was so clear she asked where the big TV was that were had the day before (referring to the screen that was up the day before). This was one of the best investments we have made. I have to admit that I was a bit sceptical about getting a projector. Now I'm wondering why we have a TV. We all love, love, love this.
customer_reviews.author: Team Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Great Value but doesn't have all the bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised, but it does not have a wide angle lens. This means you will need to be back at least 20 feet to get the full projection. Additionally it does not have any Wireless or smart capability. So you would need a smart stick to get apps directly from the projector. Color and brightness are great!
customer_reviews.author: Barnard Cross

customer_reviews.title: The colors and sharpness= simply amazing. 3
customer_reviews.text: Perfection for the price. 1. My eyes see no rainbow effect. 2. The colors and sharpness= simply amazing. 3. The system is very quiet. More so on eco mode. Note: To get the best out of the projector, especially when connected to a PC or laptop, you must go into your video/desktop settings and fine tune your picture! 100%. Go get one.
customer_reviews.author: Bagz

customer_reviews.title: flickering
customer_reviews.text: I got my first one and within couple of days I started seeing slight flickering. You can see the color becoming intense and then fades within seconds. Returned and got a replacement. same issue but this time the fan was much more noisy than the last one. I am not happy with this brand. One feature I liked in the negative zoom. this allows you to see larger screen at short throw. I have returned this and bought a BenQ W1070.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Good, while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This is a good projector, but it only lasted about a year for me. the hdmi ports wont display a picture all the time. I cant use it through my ht receiver, because that never works. Im going to have it serviced, but would not get another optoma when i upgrade. I had about 720 hours on it in a year, so i dont watch it that much. when i do turn it on, i expect it to work. I have no problems with the quality of the picture, but the hdmi ports problem is a big headache for me.
customer_reviews.author: G0saints!

customer_reviews.title: This projectors is great. I have it shooting straight onto a blank ...
customer_reviews.text: This projectors is great. I have it shooting straight onto a blank white wall and it works fine. 118 inches of pure awesome. It's hooked up to my PS4, so I play games and watch videos on Prime or Netflix. Be aware that this projector is not great for heavily illuminated rooms. I keep a very small lamp on behind me just to provide some ambient lighting, but image quality degrades in the presence of a bright light source.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Color needs tweaking
customer_reviews.text: First I had given this one star and was about to return it because the colors out of the box were horrendous. The skin tones in particular were lobster red. Amy Poehler on Parks and Recreation looked like a drunk gnome. The New Mexico clouds in Breaking Bad looked pink. I spent hours trying to fix it. I wrote a nasty review here and then tried one more time. This time I left most settings to default and went straight to Advanced->Colors-> Red -> Gain and reduced it a bunch. That fixed it. I would also like to recommend these color calibration pages.
customer_reviews.author: Globotrotter

customer_reviews.title: If you need a low budget Projector with native 1080P and 3200CR , this is the one for you!
customer_reviews.text: Pros Picture is amazing, I play COD on a 110 screen and it is the best no LAG at all. Cons HDMI link only turns it off but not on and I cannot figure this out. Remote control lights are way to bright I wish the connections were behind the system not on the side The fan is a little bit loud but is not a pain but in High altitude mode it is probably a pain. Not a problem in FL If you need a low budget Projector with native 1080P and 3200CR , this is the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: OSCAR

customer_reviews.title: Burned out in less than 3 months....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this projector in October. Something has gone wrong with it already. I don't know what the problem is yet, but it will not turn on and one light is "solid red" and the other light is "blinking red." According to the manual, there is not a "error code" associated with this sequence..........
customer_reviews.author: Ben Shankle

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this product to everyone!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! I could not be happier with this purchase. The projector runs very quiet unlike some I have seen before. The video projection quality is unmatched for the price and it provides 3D via DLP-Link glasses that you can buy for relatively cheap. I would recommend this product to anybody interested in a projector, but doesn't want to break the bank. I have over 500 hours on my original bulb and it shows no signs of needing to be replaced any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good projector.
customer_reviews.text: Projector works well. I toted this all around with my on an assignment for a mobile screen that doubles as a movie screen. It is bright enough to be used during the day, but has a gorgeous picture during the night. My one issue with this is that sometimes it does not want to turn on. It will give me the two orange lights. I can fix it by unplugging and plugging in the cord to the bulb. Still irritating issue to have, even if the fix is rather quick.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Great projector. Was shining on a grey bed sheet ...
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. Was shining on a grey bed sheet and even that looked great. Bought an elite screen 100" and it looks even better. Colors look great, even with factory setting. Had a friend adjust colors and everything just gets better and better. Be sure to use some proper techniques when mounting. Center the projector with the screen so you don't get any pitch or weird angles. Have yet to try 3D.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Awesome projector! The picture quality is great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector! The picture quality is great. It has 2 hdmi inputs and an aux output for sound. The only downfall is that the dust cover for the lense moves the picture adjustment. So every time you put on the diety cover you have to readjust the picture. It does get kinda hot and makes some noise. But if you're watching tv the sound usually isn't louder than the nose from the projector
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Trevizo

customer_reviews.title: Picture is great!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this projector. We have it mounted at 16' for a 130" screen, and the picture is crystal clear. You can see fine crows feet lines at the corners of the football commentator's eyes. We have it projected on an untextured, light colored wall, and have two pretty bright lamps on in the room.
customer_reviews.author: KH1186

customer_reviews.title: Vibrant color
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and comes with the basics: unit, power cord, remote, and manual on cd. No connections for AV cables, hdmi cable required not included. Quality piece but need blue ray and very large screen to fully appreciate. Gets hot but perhaps normal because it is very bright. Color is awesome. Would love to see 3d but 3d glasses extra cost and some real expensive, need sample pair to pre-determine value. One more note, large screen tv's can not outperform a video projector such as this.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Ditlow

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: So far I've watched a movie on this projector and played some video games. I'm not noticing any delay from the projector on fast paced games. The colors are vivid and the brightness is incredible. Very watchable with the lights on (100w equivalent LED light bulb right above the screen) and nearly perfect when it's just window light coming in! Cons: makes my 47" TV look tiny after watching.
customer_reviews.author: Brisa117

customer_reviews.title: ... only had this for about a week but am happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for about a week but am happy with the purchase. Video quality is excellent even on a white wall (slightly textured) I am currently displaying on. I tried the video settings that were posted by a previous review but found it too be to red. Even adjusting the red control all the way down with those settings, faces looked like they just returned from the Bahamas and were sunburned.The default positions seem better. I have not tried to adjust to my own liking yet because I am happy with the default. For my purposes, it is exactly what I was looking for. A high quality picture with multiple input capability.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W Neal

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this projector. It's down side is that there is quite a bit of fan noise when the fan switches to high. If the room ambient temperature is high then the fan will cycle low to high a lot. The speaker works very good for my use. For movies and games I turn down the volume and use entertainment equipment speakers. After I move, going to find out how good the 3D works.
customer_reviews.author: Garbagegut

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this projector
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this projector. Originally I bought a Optoma ML750. Started having hardware issues with it after about 3 hours of use. This projector is night and day difference. Very bright and high resolution. Black levels are pretty dang good and I have not noticed any scaling artifacts. Looks great even projected on a wall. Lamp life is very generous. Especially in eco mode. Which by the way looks great and is plenty bright. Watched the Expendables last night and didn't notice any motion blur. Exploding body parts were easily seen in high def. lol. Aweeesoommmeee!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rabid Yeti

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: We really don't use this very often, and the product broke with no solution. I feel like it should last longer for the price, especially considering how infrequently we used the product. It is $300 to send it back to the factory for repair when the projector is $500-600. Will buy something from a local dealer for free repairs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MACNIX

customer_reviews.title: This is a great buy! Received mine 3/18/16 and had it up ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy! Received mine 3/18/16 and had it up and running the next day. I have not installed a screen yet but even with it just being shot on the wall it produces a fantastic image! I have it ceiling mounted 12 ft from the wall and am getting a 7' wide image that is crisp and clean! I have not used the 3D capabilities on this but plan to in the future. Also, I have seen a few comments about the fan being loud but I have not noticed it at all and it is right above my head!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: ten year old projector to this amazing projector. The picture at 120" diagonal from a ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! That's is all I can say after moving from a low def. ten year old projector to this amazing projector. The picture at 120" diagonal from a seating position of about 14' away is unbelievable. It is also super bright, even in a fully lit downstairs room. I have not yet used the 3D feature. It is also quiet enough to sit underneath it, mounted on an 8.5' ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great crisp picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Great crisp picture quality! this projector rocks. I've been using mostly for powerpoint presentations and the words come out sharp and crisp.
customer_reviews.author: mrmr3

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: For the cost I was surprised of how well it is performing! I wish it had more picture controls such as geometry top or bottom adjustments, etc. The picture is bright and clear and only watch about 4 movies on it but for the money I am very pleased! I have it ceiling mounted and the fan is quite.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Kaylor

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This projector is very nice. Has an excellent picture and the brightness is spectacular. I had to return it due to the long throw distance being longer than I calculated to get the screen size I wanted. If my room was bigger I'd have definitely kept this great product.
customer_reviews.author: Arcticzero

customer_reviews.title: Great performance.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give up cable and only watch internet. This is an excellent product. So far I've gotten maybe 500 hours and the image is clean, adjustable and it's like watching a movie at the theater. It has many features including brightness for daytime, angles, 3D and others. I would rate a 5 but have not reviewed many of these no I suspect you'll find even better for a higher price. PS this works much better than the Optima S341.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Campagna

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: A lot positive moments about this protector, one negative its noticeably noisy. I mean the fan turn on and off too often but noise on average level
customer_reviews.author: Anatoliy

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product Great Savings
customer_reviews.text: The Optima HD 26 is a perfect home theater projector, and rivals the Ben Q, or older optima pure theater projectors. Set up can be done in minutes, and the recommended ceiling mount with this HD 26 was superb - used it to adjust master setting on the ceiling mount. Very happy with purchase, shipped right away came in box right out of factory, Amazon prime delivered. JT Knowlton
customer_reviews.author: JT Knowlton

customer_reviews.title: Rewatching all our movies again!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am really enjoying this projector. The picture is for blue rays amazing on our 100" screen. We are watching all our fun movies over again. The only down side is our old DVD don't look as good now. I think it's mostly perception...going from 720 to 1080, we can really see the difference between standard and HD content. It was there before, but there is a stark difference now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great picture
customer_reviews.text: I use this in place of a TV. Works great even during the day. HD channels look awesome. Even better at night of course. Why buy an expensive 70 inch tv when you can have double that size of a picture and when its off its a blank wall. I plugged this into a TP link smart plug and synced it with an Amazon echo. Now I ask Alexa to "turn on the tv" and the projector starts up. Its pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: iknoweverything

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Hd25-lv after it broke. I didn't want to spend that much money again and gambled on this projector. So far I'm very happy. I've owned a home theater for 9 years and use it as my primary TV. My only issue with the projector is the color wheel and fan can get noisy. At the price point this is a hell of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jaboomba

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality, even in a barn!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this projector for our soon-to-be completed basement home theater, but since we had it already decided to use it in our barn to watch a Browns' game! I am a contractor, and had a 9' x 12' canvas tarp that I hung from the barn rafters. Within minutes, we had the game on and honestly forgot we were watching TV on a projector! Plenty of brightness on the "screen" despite light shining in through cracks in the barn, and every bit as high-res as our big screen in the living room. WELL worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: dave hydock

customer_reviews.title: Picture is good, sound from the internal speakers are impressive
customer_reviews.text: We definitely chose well when my husband and I selected this projector. Picture is good, sound from the internal speakers are impressive, even though we have now mounted it and use external speakers. It's not the easiest to mount since the mounts are not equally spaced at the corners like I would have assumed, making it a little difficult to get a balance.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Two Optoma DLP projectors - color wheels break on each over time
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two Optoma HD projectors in the past and while initial experience is positive, both have had color wheels that shattered and issues with bulbs. One bulb issue may be due to the color wheel shattering. Bottom line, i will be switching manufacturers on my next device as Optoma quality is not as expected.
customer_reviews.author: mitchhit

customer_reviews.title: Love it - Great image, bright, clear and truly HD
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for a couple months now and absolutely love it. I made my own screen using particle board painted with Behr "Silver Screen" paint which you can get at Home Depot. The image is amazingly clear at 84" (Diagonal 16:9) I have it suspended from the ceiling and have not had any issues with it yet. I'd highly suggest this for anyone making their own home theater system.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Had this projector for over 6 months now and no ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this projector for over 6 months now and no issues. The picture is crystal clear and I do not miss watching on a small tv. If you are putting in a theater room this projector is a must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Twall

customer_reviews.title: Super light weight and image quality is outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight and image quality is outstanding. Speakers are weak but that's not a con because you should expect to get better speakers for a home theater setup. You can't go wrong with Optoma!
customer_reviews.author: M. Tsang

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture quality!
customer_reviews.text: This projector is great...I bought a home that had an earlier Optoma (from '05) installed and, though it still worked, the picture quality was poor. This newer model has great picture definition - the pro I had install it liked it enough to buy it for his own home. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Moots

customer_reviews.title: Buzzing noise already
customer_reviews.text: Bought this projector Dec 2015 and now Nov 2017 it has a buzzing noise that is very annoying when watching it. Great picture for the money but to have this noise already is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: So far this is an awesome, crisp, deep color HD Projector
customer_reviews.text: So far this is an awesome, crisp, deep color HD Projector. Am in the process of fixing up basement to use as Media room. Had needed a new TV in the room and for the price it would be difficult to purchase a TV in any kind of size, especially not as large as the Optima projects. It is awesome and rivals most TV pics!
customer_reviews.author: SLP

customer_reviews.title: great brightness, very easy to use with lots of ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly clear picture, great brightness, very easy to use with lots of settings. Only downside is limited zoom lens, which limits you to projecting from a very specific distance away from your screen. With the right projector mount, however, this is not much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Barry-Garland

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the price
customer_reviews.text: played Force Awakens on it as soon as I got it. Looked fabulous! Great projector for the price. Keep it cool though, it does not handle heat very well, at all really.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Willoretta

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: After doing extensive research on various projectors on the market, I decided to go with the HD26. I couldn't be more happy. The thing that most impressed me was the lumens. I am able to watch something with the lights on. This was improtant to me because I don't have a dedicated theater room so I wanted to be able to play games while watch the projector. The only word of caution I would give is that it doesn't have a lens shift feature so it is a little more difficult to get it exactly where you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good projector for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good projector for the price. Clear picture and quiet. If you get the projector and it's a little noisy. There is a setting you can change to to turn down the fans. This setting is typically for high elevations. Hope that helps anyone who thinks it's noisy. Because I was thinking of sending it back at first before I figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Meyers

customer_reviews.title: optoma hd 26 is the best
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect Projector I bought optoma hd66 from Two years ago but this is different and better Colors perfect and Excellent clarity I use it in games and movies are very excellent I advise everyone acquisition of this type because is the best Projector in the world . i love optoma
customer_reviews.author: ibrahem

customer_reviews.title: Great projector. Unfortunately i was seeing the DLP rainbow ...
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. Unfortunately i was seeing the DLP rainbow effect with it. I never had that issue with the TVs or other high-end projectors, but it was a deal breaker on this one. Picture quality, color, and sharpness were fantastic for a projector at this price range. Despite the fact that there are only manual zoom and manual focus, it was very easy to get a great looking picture out of this projector. If you don't have issues with the rainbow effect from DLP technology, this is a fabulous option for an entry level projector.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about buying a projector, but I couldn't see spending so much money on a slightly bigger tv than my current 60". This projector more than exceeded my expectations. I used a cheaper alternative to buy'n a screen because I didn't want to limit the size of the projection, so I painted the wall with BEHR Marquee Silver Screen Flat. The picture quality is just as good as an LCD tv. I'm so glad I decided to go with a projector.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Burns

customer_reviews.title: Nice Projector!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when my Viewsonic Projector died. It's a way better picture and definitely a lot brighter. My wife and I enjoy watching sports games on it as well as playing video games and watching Netflix. The colors turn out really well even though we don't have a screen. Basically, this thing rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Traum

customer_reviews.title: The cost/benefit makes this a very good buy. The setup and use are simple
customer_reviews.text: This is a tremendous projector. The cost/benefit makes this a very good buy. The setup and use are simple. The 3D is tremendous (using DLP link glasses). Fairly quiet. This unit does take a little bit of touch to fine tune the focus and zoom as these are manual adjustments. Small and light.
customer_reviews.author: Tar Heel 87

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Projector for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Projector for the money. Coming from an HD33 that recently died on me this was a fantastic replacement. Excellent picture and viewing options this projector has it all. With huge screen options all under 600 dollars buying this product was a no brainer. With my current set up at 14ft away I am able to project 110in in beautiful HD.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Great for movie night
customer_reviews.text: Have it outside on a covered deck. It's about 15' away from a screen. Works VERY, VERY well at night. Great for movie night, Monday and Thursday night football and playing video games! Not great in the daytime, but I'm not sure many projectors are.
customer_reviews.author: lifeofelove

customer_reviews.title: Does not last..
customer_reviews.text: Great while it worked. I had this unit for 16 months and now has issues powering up. Th unit makes 3 loud humming noises around the lens area when starting up. After 2 minutes it shuts down and light turn red. Tried 3 new bulbs, no change. The unit has some major issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gamehendge

customer_reviews.title: Exceded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: My first projector ever and I have to admit it... this is an amazing piece of technology. The comments of other amazon customers about its resolution make sense now. I live in a small room and I'm able to get a screen of 92" diagonally on a white wall and it does look very clear and crispy. The colors are so vibrant, I feel like I am part of the movies watch or the games I play. Even greater than this is the fact that you can use this Optoma HD26 projector with a pair of 3D glasses. I got myself the EStar America ESG6100 RF-3D glasses and ohhhh my... this is really good. I'm glad I bought this projector.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: This is great. We may never buy a TV again
customer_reviews.text: Update June 2017 the audio has completely gone on the fritz!!! :( This is great. We may never buy a TV again. This works wonderfully. We have connected it to various devices with no issues. The speaker works well. We don't even us a screen or a wall painted with the prooper paint.
customer_reviews.author: Hi-D

customer_reviews.title: The 2nd projector was great. Everything worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: The first projector I bought had an issue with the lamp. It worked but you could not see the projection at all with any amount of light on. I had seen many videos of this projector working with the lights on so I knew something was wrong. I returned the projector and got a replacement from Amazon. The 2nd projector was great. Everything worked as expected. The projection was bright and colorful. The 3D is great (using DLP link glasses) and I have not noticed any cross talk like with my 50" passive TV.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: after a year and easily under 50 uses
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these about year ago. Used in a catering hall, therefore has minimal use, and is only used about 3-5 times a month. after a year and easily under 50 uses, the projector is completely shot. After calling Optoma and explaining our problem, they told us they could fix it for 450+shipping. Terrible customer support and warranty, company doesn't stand behind their "Quality" products. Don't buy if you enjoy be treated like a human if something happens to go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Longo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the price
customer_reviews.text: This projector is great, especially for the price. I was looking for some thing with great colors and rich blacks. This projector in some cases done it's job too well. The colors became so bright that they ran together creating posterization and some scenes the blacks were too dark for my test. Though both of these issues were rare and once I tweaked the settings to taste, I only had a beautiful picture that kept me wanting to watch movie after movie on this stunning large screen.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from Optoma HD20 to HD26
customer_reviews.text: Just upgraded my optoma hd20 ( 2009 ) to this recent model hd26 ( 2014 ) !!! this is incredible how projectors evolved during the last years. For me this is probably one of the best value on the market for this price. Brightness, contrast, and blacks really worth the upgrade. Love my new ( and previous ) optoma projector.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas R.

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert or have benchmarked against comparable projectors, but I believe the Optoma HD26 is very good deal. I love the remote's glowing buttons, the quality of the HDMI sound and overall functions. Compared with my offices classic WXGA projectors I think there is a good deal of heat coming from the Optoma, so make sure it's well vented. I installed a small fan next to it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Great product i got for a steal from Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: Bought it from Amazon Warehouse in usable condition. I was expecting it to be missing some pieces or have scratches all over it. It's in pristine condition. only 100 hours on the bulb (or so it says) Give a brilliant and vibrant 100" picture at about 13 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: A. Garvin

customer_reviews.title: The most amazing projector
customer_reviews.text: The most amazing projector i bought, cost / quality this is a very nice projector. i have it 6 meters from the wall and the image its nice and crisp. ant that distance i'm having a little more than 3 meters wide image. at night its nice to whats a movie with my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: The price and picture are right!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a brighter picture, and this projector gave it. It's also lightweight. The price of $500+ is one-fourth that of the projector I had decided to buy if its price ever came down from the $2000 level. I'm glad this Optoma was recommended to me by a friend, and even happier that I bought it. Don't know how durable it will be, but right now I'm 5-star happy!
customer_reviews.author: 67falcon

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for the HD20
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded from an HD20 after it caught fire (was 5 or so years old and we may have put the wrong kind of replacement bulb in it - watch for that). It is much brighter, just as clear and very easy to install using the same ceiling mount hardware as we used for the HD20 with a little wiggling.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Katafias

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This projector is amazing! The quality is phenomenal, the cooling fan inside isn't loud at all and it's very portable for enjoying movies outside! I definitely recommend this projector!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Short Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Was a great projector until it's 406th hour of use. All of a sudden I turn it on and it's unusably dim. No gradual degradation, just all of a sudden the luminosity is a fraction of what it used to be. The bulb supposedly has a lifespan of 6500 hours in the bright setting according to Optoma's website. Guess I'm a over 6000 hours short.
customer_reviews.author: Ranjeev M

customer_reviews.title: Loud Fan
customer_reviews.text: Great image, but the fan was loud, it was distracting during quiet scenes. Returned this and I picked up the BenQ W1070, has better image quality (incredible contrast and colors) and was more quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Andy and Leah Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Projector priced just right
customer_reviews.text: I won't buy a TV again. This projector is nice, even in the day with no screen, just projecting onto a matte white wall. Crisp picture, definitely worthy of being called 1080p. So many compliments and unwanted guests :-D I'm a heavy user - I'm thinking I'll get 5 years out of the lamp without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

product_meta.title: Optoma HD26 1080p 3D DLP Home Theater Projector
feature_bullets: Screen Size Range: 71-inches from 8 feet; 107-inches from 12 feet
Contrast Ratio: 25,000:1; Keystone Correction: Yes, Lens Shift: No
Warranty: 1-Year Limited Parts and Labor, 90-Days on Lamp
Inputs: 2 x HDMI (1.4a 3D support) + MHL, Audio Out 3.5mm, 12V trigger, 3D-Sync, USB service

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars699 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
